questions.question_text: A company commissioned a site survey to check wireless network coverage. The technician noticed undesirable levels of RSSI in different areas of the office. Which of the following levels did the technician most likely notice?

discussion.content: I passed today. I studied 1-852 until I felt good about it. Most of the questions I had were towards the end of this dump. Only two of the pbq questions I had were on here. I wouldn't haven't of passed without studying this whole thing though. Thanks to everyone and ExamTopics for the help. Good luck to all. STUDY THOSE PBQS AND YOU CAN FIND THEM!

Selected Answer: A
All RSSI values will be negative, but the closer to 0, the stronger. In this case, -82dBm is going to be very weak, and what the tech is looking for

Selected Answer: A
-82dBm is considered a weak signal and can lead to connectivity issues, making it undesirable for reliable wireless network performance. Signals in the range of -70dBm to -85dBm can experience dropped connections, slow speeds, and inconsistent performance.

questions.question_text: A network administrator will be running Ethernet cables through raised ceilings. Which of the following types of Ethernet cables is the safest solution?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
When running Ethernet cables through raised ceilings, which are often used as air ducts for heating and cooling, the safest choice is plenum cable. Plenum-rated cables are designed to be used in spaces where air circulation is needed, and they have fire-resistant insulation that prevents the spread of flames and toxic smoke in the event of a fire.

A. Shielded: While shielded cables offer protection against electromagnetic interference (EMI), they do not address fire safety requirements for use in plenum spaces.

C. Unshielded: Unshielded cables lack both the fire-resistant insulation and protection against EMI, making them unsuitable for use in raised ceilings or other spaces where fire safety and interference are concerns.

D. Riser: Riser cables are designed for vertical spaces between floors and have fire-resistant properties to prevent the spread of flames. They are not suitable for plenum spaces as they do not have the necessary fire-resistant insulation for air circulation areas.
This one was on my test that I took on 10/30/2024. There were only 4 commands that shows up after typing help. Commands are - Show Interface, Show ARP, Show MAC Address-Table, Show Vlan.

Switch 1:
Check the VLAN configuration using commands like show vlan brief or show interfaces switchport

If the VLAN settings are misconfigured or the server is on a different VLAN than intended, it will cause communication issues.

The fact that the "Incorrect VLAN" option is the selected answer indicates that the VLAN mismatch was found on this switch.

Switch 2:
Run show interfaces status or show ip interface brief to check the status of the interfaces.

If the interface between Access Switch 2 and another device (e.g., Storage) is showing as down or not connected, the cause is a disconnected interface.

Core Switch 1:
Similar to Access Switch 1, use the show vlan brief command to verify VLAN configuration on the Core Switch.

The core switch is responsible for routing traffic between different segments of the network. If there is a VLAN misconfiguration on the core switch, devices across the network would not communicate properly.

comments.content: This is only correct if the awnser given is correct.

discussion.content: I had this one on my test. Unfortunately think I missed it even though I passed pretty comfortably. The commands it gives you are something like show interface, show mac address table, show IP address and show vlan. The core switch had both servers set up with 2 vlans outside the default one. The access switches had the correct vlans set up on the port going to the core switch but only had one vlan set for the server/storage that they were connected to. I couldn't find any interface issues.

questions.question_text: Outside traffic from local subnet is using an infernal web server. A technician must apply best practices to ensure outside users can only access the web server and not any other internal resources. Which of the following should the technician do to best addresses the issue?

choices.B: Connect the web server to the WAN.
choices.D: Block incoming port 80 and port 443 traffic to the server.
choices.A: Move the web server to a perimeter network.
choices.C: Connect the server directly to a second port on the cable modem.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
This option is correct because placing the web server in a perimeter network (also known as a DMZ) ensures that external users can access the web server without being able to access internal network resources. This method separates the web server from the internal network and provides an additional layer of security.

B. Connect the web server to the WAN is incorrect because this exposes the server directly to the internet without any protection, leaving it vulnerable to attacks.

C. Connect the server directly to a second port on the cable modem is incorrect because it also exposes the server to external traffic without any security controls or isolation from internal resources.

D. Block incoming port 80 and port 443 traffic to the server is incorrect because these ports are necessary for HTTP and HTTPS traffic. Blocking these ports would prevent the web server from being accessible to outside users entirely.

comments.content:
To remember this:

East-West = Horizontal movement: Think of this as moving across the same floor of a building or within the same department in an office.

North-South = Vertical movement: Think of this as moving between different floors of a building or from one building to another.

Hopes this helps anyone.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
This is the correct answer because east-west traffic refers to the movement of data packets between devices or servers within the same data center or network, such as between servers or between virtual machines. Isolating east-west traffic helps to prevent unauthorized access and improve security within the internal network by ensuring that only specific devices or servers can communicate with each other.

B. Access/edge refers to the flow of data between end-user devices and the network, which is less relevant to isolating traffic between internal devices or servers.

C. Core/distribution refers to the layers of a network where traffic flows are aggregated and managed. While important for routing traffic, it doesn't focus on isolating device/server traffic.

D. North-south refers to traffic that flows between internal networks and external entities (e.g., the internet), which is less relevant to isolating internal traffic.

Selected Answer: A
If it's internal it's east west guys.

Selected Answer: A
It's east west because it's the internal network. North south is only when it deals with external networks and servers.

Selected Answer: A
I’d have. To say East-West it is speaking of data of any sort or in coming or outbound traffic. Yet it refers to an internal firewall where the goal can be to thwart or mitigate lateral attacks if access is gained on the network.
Server to client communication is considered North-South traffic

Selected Answer: D
I believe it's D because servers usually exist one level up from users.

questions.question_text: A technician is working on a solution to isolate traffic between specific types of devices, servers, and users on the internal firewall. Which of the following traffic flows should be isolated?
